title: rustysee
author: rustysee
content: Hello,Who is willing to contribute to a project idea with bitcoin usecase?

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Might want to give a few more details

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: rustysee on May 18, 2022, 06:59:22 AMHere is the first draft:https://www.seesolutions.it/documents/SensingExchangeCapital_WHITEPAPER.pdfI've done a quick "scan" in the pdf and:* I see there smart contracts, I see there BNB... I don't see Bitcoin at all. So where's the Bitcoin use case there? (because if it's missing, then this may suit altcoin discussion)* The use of SEC acronym can be greatly misleading.Some things are not well explained, some others may be overly explained and made me skip parts. It does have the potential to work, but with modifications and only if you get actual data consumers ask for specific data they need (and actually pay for it), i.e. by request. Unless you do that, you'll end up with a huge pile of useless data. You also either avoided, or missed the part of data storage. The huge amount of data will have to be stored somewhere and it's unclear who will store that data and who will pay for that storage (I hope that you don't expect the data be stored on the blockchain). And the storage may have to be on a reliable high availability servers (i.e. expensive).

comments.author: rustysee
comments.body: Thank you for you feedback. I really appreciate your comments.The smart contract described here is just intended to launch the project, and not for the actual project use case.The project may rely on multiple blockchains, Bitcoin will of course be an important integral part.The data usage usecases will be evaluated. Data will also be aggragated in the mining process. Data will have a limited retention time, based on a usage score. Important Data (based on usage score) will be stored also on professional storage founded by the liquidity pools . In general data will be stored on P2P distributed storage. This was a first draft and I will elaborate further.Thank you again for your comments.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: rustysee on May 18, 2022, 07:54:20 AMData will have a limited retention time, based on a usage score.If the data is produced by request, the buyer will probably make his own copy and no longer need the source, hence the source will get over time low usage score.If the data is produced "just for the sake of it", then it may or may not have good usage, most probably not from the start (unless it's a very strong news) and may be discarded before somebody find out its usefulness.So the limited retention time may be a very hard to fine-tune two edged sword.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: rustysee on May 18, 2022, 06:27:26 AMWho is willing to contribute to a project idea with bitcoin usecase?Not me, because I would only contribute you in selling your new shitcoin created on binance chain.I looked at document you posted and only two times you are mentioning word Bitcoin is in a context that you are comparing it with bitcoin mining process.Not saying that this project is a scam, and I see on your website that you worked on other real projects before, but maybe you should consider different approach here.Quote from: rustysee on May 18, 2022, 07:54:20 AMThe project may rely on multiple blockchains, Bitcoin will of course be an important integral part.Can you explain how exactly?I don't see any mention about it in whitepaper or anywhere else on your website.

comments.author: rustysee
comments.body: Thank you for your feedback.Bitcoin iself will be used in the Liquidity Pools and for data transactions (data encryption key exchange).Data mining will be similar to the concept of bitcoin, a decentralized network of nodes, but instead of performing PoW, the nodes will perform data validation and aggregation. The quality of data will be an important driver.This was just a first draft and I'll describe the whole process in more detail soon. I belive that data will become more and more important in future.Would be great if you can help me for the shitcoin:) This will help me to start.Thanks again for your comments

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Quote from: rustysee on May 18, 2022, 12:22:12 PMBitcoin iself will be used in the Liquidity Pools and for data transactions (data encryption key exchange).Still no “usecase”
